member.name: T:Riskmaster.DataModel.DataObject
member.summary: Base class for all ported RMObjLib classes. Only holds "disconnected" data items.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.DataModel.DataObject.Delete
member.summary: TODO Delete

member.name: M:Riskmaster.DataModel.DataObject.OnForceParentSave
member.summary:
Provides an interception point for derived classes to decide whether or not the save should be bubbled to a parent object and handled there instead.
Overridden only in implementing classes that choose NOT to bubble saves.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.DataModel.DataObject.OnBuildNewUniqueId
member.summary:
Provides an interception point for derived classes to generate and assign a new unique key from the glossary (or not as desired.)
Overridden only in implementing classes that choose NOT to generate a glossary unique row id.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.DataModel.DataObject.OnPreCommitSave
member.summary: Provides an interception point for derived classes to handle singleton activities required before the full save can be committed.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.DataModel.DataObject.OnPostCommitSave
member.summary: Provides an interception point for derived classes to handle singleton activities required immediately after the full save has been committed.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.DataModel.DataObject.OnPreCommitDelete
member.summary: Provides an interception point for derived classes to handle singleton activities required before the full delete can be committed. This code is run IF AND ONLY IF the delete is INITIATED on this object. It ONLY runs on the object upon which client code initiated the deletion. It is NEVER invoked on a "cascading" deleted object.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.DataModel.DataObject.OnPostCommitDelete
member.summary: Provides an interception point for derived classes to handle singleton activities required immediately after the full delete has been committed. This code is run IF AND ONLY IF the delete is INITIATED on this object. It ONLY runs on the object upon which client code initiated the deletion. It is NEVER invoked on a "cascading" deleted object.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.DataModel.DataObject.Save
member.summary: Save provides a basic save functionality calling out to overridden methods for custom logic in the implementing classes.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.DataModel.DataObject.Refresh
member.summary: Refresh clears the values for all fields and children.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.DataModel.DataObject.CallOnChildPreSave(System.String,Riskmaster.DataModel.IDataModel)
member.summary: Used as a spot to ensure that DataChangedFlag gets locked before the child object linkages are updated. Ensures that the simple act of setting linkages does not cause an otherwise blank record to wind up looking "changed" and hence add a blank row to the database.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.DataModel.DataObject.OnChildPreSave(System.String,Riskmaster.DataModel.IDataModel)
member.summary: Called during save before the top level class saves it's fields.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.DataModel.DataObject.CallOnChildPostSave(System.String,Riskmaster.DataModel.IDataModel,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Used as a spot to ensure that DataChangedFlag gets locked before the child object linkages are updated. Ensures that the simple act of setting linkages does not cause an otherwise blank record to wind up looking "changed" and hence add a blank row to the database.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.DataModel.DataObject.OnChildPostSave(System.String,Riskmaster.DataModel.IDataModel,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Called during save after the top level class saves it's fields.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.DataModel.DataObject.CallOnChildItemAdded(System.String,Riskmaster.DataModel.IDataModel)
member.summary: Used as a spot to ensure that DataChangedFlag gets locked before the child object linkages are updated. Ensures that the simple act of setting linkages does not cause an otherwise blank record to wind up looking "changed" and hence add a blank row to the database.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.DataModel.DataObject.Clear
member.summary: Simplistic implementation clears all standard Field data from the object.
member.remarks: Not previously standard but common enough to include here.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.DataModel.WpaDiaryEntry.ToHtml(System.String[])
member.summary: Return an html page with a 2-column HTML table (field name, field value) that contains selected diary information.

member.name: T:Riskmaster.DataModel.Supplementals
member.summary: Summary description for Supplementals.

member.name: T:Riskmaster.DataModel.SupplementalObject
member.summary: Summary description for Supplementals.IDataModel,

member.name: M:Riskmaster.DataModel.SupplementalObject.Load
member.summary: Clear all supp field values that are not the primary key. Add supp field values that are primary key to SQL statement that loads the supp field values from the database. If primary key value == 0, do not run the query that loads the supp object from the database (thus leave all values null except primary key).

member.name: T:Riskmaster.DataModel.DataCollection
member.summary: The base class for an iteratable collection used to represent 1 to many record relationships from the parent side.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.DataModel.DataCollection.IsReady
member.summary: Checks if the following information has been provided: 1.) What datatype to use. 2.) How to select the collection member rows. 3.) What table the rows are in. 4.) What field is the table key.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.DataModel.DataCollection.Remove(System.Int32)
member.summary: This function flags the in memory collection member item as having been removed. This will ONLY result in an IPersistence.Delete call at the time this object is saved.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.DataModel.DataCollection.PopulateObject(System.Xml.XmlDocument,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: TODO Figure out syntax for Internal Deletion where delete is not always a top level user action.

member.name: F:Riskmaster.DataModel.DataCollection.m_keyPropertyName
member.summary: Privately tries to ask the first member of the current collection what the item's key property name is. If no members are available, then a temporary object is created.

member.name: T:Riskmaster.DataModel.DataModelFactory
member.summary: Factory class centrally controls creation of DataModel objects. Takes responsibility for ensuring that all common initialization information has been accepted and populates the Context property of each object during creation.

member.summary: TODO: Summary of Riskmaster.DataModel.DataModelFactory.Initialize.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.DataModel.DataModelFactory.#ctor(Riskmaster.Security.UserLogin)
member.summary: Summary of Riskmaster.DataModel.DataModelFactory.DataModelFactory. This ctor takes a pre-populated UserLogin object. This accomplishes two things: 1.) Avoids moving pwds around the system in plain-text. 2.) Performance improvement becuase duplication of Security Database authentication can be eliminated.
member.param: Existing UserLogin object representing a logged in user.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.DataModel.DataModelFactory.Initialize(Riskmaster.Security.UserLogin)
member.summary: TODO: Summary of Riskmaster.DataModel.DataModelFactory.Initialize.
member.param: Existing UserLogin object representing a logged in user.
member.remarks: used by the Ctor with matching signature to avoid duplicating the Authentication logic.

member.name: T:Riskmaster.DataModel.PersonInvolved
member.summary:
Summary of PersonInvolved AutoGenerated Class.
The following Persons Involved types are derived from this base: PIWitness PIOther PIEmployee PIPatient PIPhysician PIMedstaff
Note however, that PIPatient now simply links up to the Quest patient object and is NOT the same as the older legacy PIPatient. This also means that the following legacy tables and objlib objects are only used from PiEmployee and no longer used nor represented directly from the updated "PiPatient": PiXInjury PiXBodyPart PiXHospital PiXPhysician PiXDiagnosis PiXTreatment PiXProcedure

member.name: T:Riskmaster.DataModel.DataChildList
member.summary: DataChildList contains a list of names and values for all child objects or "child object lists". Used by the base DataObject to handle children objects. Notes: 1.) Typically individual child objects will be wrapped in DataLazyLoader wrapper objects. 2.) "Child object lists" (example: PersonsInvolved) will be fully loaded but their member objects will each be wrapped in DataLazyLoader wrapper objects.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.DataModel.DataChildList.ToString
member.summary: ToString is overridden to provide a comma separated list of field names suitable for use in SQL queries.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.DataModel.Funds.GenerateDiary(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generate a Diary Entry for the sDiaryUser containing the detail

member.name: M:Riskmaster.DataModel.Funds.GetTotalPaidForClaim(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate the Total Paid on a Given Claim under a particular Coverage with the exception of amounts from the supplied TransIdToExclude param.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.DataModel.Funds.GetTotalCollectionForClaim(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Mihika - MITS 8657 Given a FUNDS record ID , a coverage record ID, and a claim ID, return the Effective total void payments and Collection record for this claim against this coverage.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.DataModel.Funds.GetTotalCollForEvent(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Mihika - MITS 8657 Given a FUNDS record ID, a coverage record ID, and a claim ID, return the total collection recorded for this event against this coverage (insurance.) Note that we join three tables: CLAIM,COVERAGE_X_FUNDS, and FUNDS. We need FUNDS and CLAIM so we can locate all FUNDSs that are related to a set of one or more CLAIMs that in turn are related to a specified EVENT.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.DataModel.Funds.UpdatePolicyAmounts(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Given a 'FUNDS' table record that is the current record in the dynaset, apply any necessary updating of the insurance policy coverages according to the effective 'insurance layers'; notify the user if the layers were not sufficient to satisfy the payment; propogate payment to higher layers if any of the three per policy limits were exceeded (per claim, per occurrence, total policy.)
If bDelete is TRUE, delete the FUNDS record's policy amount information, ' IE, undo it from the policies to which it may be posted, and do not enter any policy updates for this FUNDS record. If FALSE, assumes that the FUNDS record is being added or updated.
This is a 'heads down' function that is to be called 'mindlessly' when any FUNDS record is added, modified, or deleted. The only requirement is that this function must be called when the dynaset object contains the current FUNDS record pending the policy updating. The routine knows what to do.
member.returns: Returns FALSE if there was a critical error during record processing. A transaction surrounding this procedure should be rolled back if it returns FALSE, committed if it returns TRUE.
